intro: Schmidtia quinqueseta, commonly known as the New Zealand broom, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas. The plant has erect, slender stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. Schmidtia quinqueseta is known for its ability to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
